title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Brazil is inefficiently using its resources and/or does not explain that it is producing at a point below its production possibilities curve.
The response states that Brazil is inefficiently using its resources and explains that it is producing at a point below its production possibilities curve.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Brazil has the comparative advantage in the production of beef and/or does not explain that Brazil has the lower opportunity cost in producing beef: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of beef in Brazil is 0.1 unit of coffee and in Argentina it is 0.25 unit of coffee.

The response states that Brazil has the comparative advantage in the production of beef and explains that Brazil has the lower opportunity cost in producing beef: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of beef in Brazil is 0.1 unit of coffee and in Argentina it is 0.25 unit of coffee.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, Argentina will not gain from trade and/or does not explain that these terms of trade are less than Argentina’s opportunity cost of producing coffee.
The response states that no, Argentina will not gain from trade and explains that these terms of trade are less than Argentina’s opportunity cost of producing coffee.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Argentina’s opportunity cost of producing beef will increase and/or does not explain that it will have to give up more units of coffee to produce each unit of beef.
The response states that Argentina’s opportunity cost of producing beef will increase and explains that it will have to give up more units of coffee to produce each unit of beef.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the number of employed people in Argentina as 28 million and/or does not show the work.
